definition: to show filial respect/to give presents (to one's elders or superiors)/to support one's aged parents

sentences.english: The children treated their parents with filial respect.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子孝敬他们的双亲。

sentences.english: Is filial piety the parents, respects division commander, politeness treats people.
sentences.chinese: 孝敬父母，尊敬师长，礼貌待人。

sentences.english: Each of you must respect his mother and father, and you must observe my Sabbaths.
sentences.chinese: 你们各人都当孝敬父母，也要守我的安息日。

sentences.english: Our family is very pleased to have a such a good family tradition and honor the elderly.
sentences.chinese: 很高兴我们家有一个这么好的孝敬老人的家风。

sentences.english: Honor their parents, others, Thanksgiving is the traditional virtue of Chinese nation.
sentences.chinese: 孝敬父母，感恩他人是我们中华民族的传统美德。

sentences.english: There is something in us—written on our hearts—that says, "Honor your father and mother.
sentences.chinese: 对我们而言都有一句铭记于心的话“孝敬父母”。

sentences.english: Say that becomes useful not to money she, anti- show filial obedience his father-in-law to money?If unmanned of O.
sentences.chinese: 难道说赵成材不给钱她了，反把钱孝敬他岳父了？

sentences.english: Filial piety towards parents, is that to which we should holdfast.
sentences.chinese: 孝敬父母，就是我们应当向黄香学习的思想品德。

sentences.english: He had imbibed at Geneva the idea that one must always attentive to one's aunt.
sentences.chinese: 他在日内瓦时就有了这种想法，他一定要孝敬姑母。

sentences.english: Not only that, but your parents.
sentences.chinese: 不仅如此，还要孝敬父母。

sentences.english: You never have to Thanksgiving and Xiaojing of your parents.
sentences.chinese: 你永远要感恩和孝敬你的父母。

sentences.english: Huang Xiang of the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220 AD) treated his father with filial respect from childhood.
sentences.chinese: 东汉时有个叫黄香的人，从小孝敬父亲。

sentences.english: The fifth commandment obligates children to honor their father and mother.
sentences.chinese: 第五诫教育孩子有义务孝敬父母。

sentences.english: For the son of man should know filial piety, is an undefeated flower.
sentences.chinese: 为人子应知孝敬，孝心是一朵不败的花。

sentences.english: Honour thy father and thy DongXiaoHan father-in-law, not love, family are very harmonious.
sentences.chinese: 董晓晗孝敬公公，爱护小姑，一家人很和睦。

sentences.english: What will you do to honor your parents on the the Double Ninth Festival?
sentences.chinese: 重阳节到了，你准备如何孝敬父母？

definition: to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
filial piety (a Confucian obligation)/respect and obedience to one's parents
to bestow/to confer (a reward for service)/a reward
gift given to sb when meeting them for the first time
to look after one's aged parents and arrange proper burial after they die
I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
to support/to provide support for/to maintain
